author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sugarcane growers on Thursday staged a road roko in Mayiladuthurai demanding an increase in procurement price of sugarcane to Rs. 4,000 per tonne.

Kasinathan, secretary, Tamil Nadu Sugarcane Farmers’ Association, presided over the agitation.

The farmers, who staged the protest near Sub Collector’s office in Mayiladuthurai, raised slogans against the State government and the sugar mill for failing to keep the promise made to farmers. They demanded that the Cooperative Sugar Mill at Thalaignayiru should start crushing the cane immediately.

Compliance with State government’s last year order on State Advised Price (SAP) and sanction of transport cost were among their other demands. Later, the police detained more than 50 persons for staging a road roko.

Traffic on Mayiladurai-Tiruvarur road was affected for about an hour because of the agitation.
title: Sugarcane growers block road in Mayiladuthurai
